greenie Claude asked how do you prepare
to travel to countries that speak a
different language do you learn the
basics or use an app what's been the
biggest hurdle with language so there's
a couple different tricks that I I apply
when traveling places that don't speak
English or don't speak English well
surprisingly though most of the world
you can get around with English English
is like the universal travel languages
shocking how well you can travel around
the world using just English
a couple things that I do do is if I
know that there's not be a lot of
English speaking in the place that I'm
going to which I'll research before go
to is I will book an accommodation that
has English speakers so I'll book a
hotel or hostel that I know well if
somebody that speaks English there that
is the number one tip I can give you
guys because they can tell you how to
get to places where to eat where to stay
they can tell you hours they can help
you book stuff they can literally help
you plan your entire trip and answer all
your questions when you are in that
country so stay at an accommodation that
has an English speaker that can help you
sort out the rest of your everyday
plans when you're in that country the
other thing is I do learn a couple of
the basic phrases like hello thank you
how much etc I will look that up
beforehand to kind of try and memorize
and practice them because that's just
good to know in general another tip is I
use Google Translate as such a great app
there are many different ways and you
could translate that or all by like a
little translate book but normally I

but like I said shockingly easy to get
